validation.data_quality_notes: Strong historical documentation for Operation Compass period. Complete order of battle confirmed from Wikipedia OOB list. Tank numbers estimated as division's share of 275 WDF tanks (7th Armoured had ~195 tanks, 7th RTR Matildas were corps troops). Personnel strength estimated at ~19,500 based on 7th Armoured being main component of 36,000-strong WDF. Artillery numbers reflect partial battery allocations to 7th Support Group (full regiments not assigned until March-April 1941). Commander and brigade commanders confirmed from multiple sources. Q4 represents active operations period vs Q3 defensive posture.
validation.historical_context: 7th Armoured Division during Operation Compass (Dec 9, 1940 - Feb 9, 1941). This was the division's first major offensive operation, launching the brilliant British counter-offensive that destroyed the Italian 10th Army. The 'Desert Rats' performed their legendary role as the Western Desert Force's main striking arm. Major-General Creagh commanded the division through rapid exploitation operations covering hundreds of miles. The division's tank strength (~195) represents its share of WDF's 275 tanks, excluding the 48 Matildas of 7th RTR (corps troops). The force demonstrated exceptional mobility, navigation, and combined arms capability in defeating a numerically superior Italian force. Note that 6th RTR was detached to Selby Force, and 3rd/8th Hussars left brigade in mid-January 1941 as operations progressed.
